title: Can we address the elephant in the room with the crossbow?
body:
Ive seen a lot of complaint threads about a lot of champions: FoTM champions, niche unpopular champions, Zed. But I almost never see a complaint thread about Vayne.

Ive seen this chick in all levels of play. She is -the- snowball late game hyper carry Adc. That is her identity, that she is simply the best DPS ranged champion in the game. Even in an age of massive brutes she gets by with her health shred per three autos, and for everyone else, they can be dead before her third bolt hits them.

Her weakness is a weak early game, but her kit knows this. In fact her entire kit is a massive safety net of self peel and mobility to make sure she keeps dealing out her auto attack based damage. It's really easy for a vayne to play safe with a lane partner and farm to the late game; where she can start going ham on everyone imaginable.

She has around the same range as Quinn; another "hyper carry" with self peel. But Quinn has so many more margins of error than Vayne, and her rewards are not much different. I play a lot of Quinn, and aside from a few bug fixes, I think her design's pretty balanced. 

Vayne on the other hand, is so ridiculously streamlined for her role. You'd think an ADC with a blind, specifically built to deal with auto based champions would naturally destroy Vayne, you'd be mistaken.

Vayne's kit is so flexible she can tumble out of a Jarvan ult. She can out maneuver a caitlyn.

She's a lot like Riven, she has the tools to deal with everything, but also bring a lot of damage to the table. It doesn't help that you buffed Blade of the Ruined King yet again.

Choose one thing Riot: Is she a jack of all trades or is she a burst/dps powerhouse?

She's like a squishier mobile nasus ffs.

Give her the Tristana treatment

If you walk away while in lane after the first auto she will just Q>AA>E for quick damage, and then you've done no damage to her in return.

Post 6 waking away is no longer an option thanks to her 90+ move speed on her ult when chasing, the boost even means that short range escapes like flash aren't even very effective.

When vayne is against the right opponents her ult is essentially the Duel ability from Dota 2, just without the silence.

Vayne is a duelist. She expected to win a standard 1v1, that's what her kit revolves around.
If forced to juggle multiple threats (say... your support?) she starts falling apart. In spite of all her steroids, she doesn't have a lot of burst. She also doesn't have a lot of range, which makes peeling her and grouping up on her a lot easier.
She's not an assassin, as opposed to Quinn (mentioned in OP); who, unless condemned on approach, will 100-0 Vayne instantly.

The 3 times in a row thing also applies to Vel'Koz. And his skills are set up that he can proc 5 hits instantly if he lands his knock-up. But you don't hear people complain about the squid because it can be worked around. Vayne is better at applying her bolts, but it's also easier for her to loose them.

I mean, I've never personally had any real trouble dueling Vayne as a bruiser like Tryndamere (I usually eat them alive in fact), but I am saying that from my point of view, ADCs should never be allowed to outshine champions who specialize in dueling as a duelist. Which Vayne might not, but if she can legitimately 1v1 Master Yi, Tryndamere, or Jax that's frankly bullshit.

edit: Oh, and Vayne has the highest pick rate of any ADC in the game in Plat, Diamond, and Master+. She's seen in higher levels of play often. She also has the third highest win rate of any ADC. The notion that she is "bad" doesn't hold up.

>The problem would probably lie with the ADC class as a whole. 

With this, I agree. But riot like them, so they here to stay.
Personally, I think they should add an additional damage stat: siege damage. Damage done to structures. That way the primer objective taking class wouldn't be required to also have the highest damage output in the game.

>The notion that she is "bad" doesn't hold up. 

Please don't put words in my mouth. It tastes terrible and I don't know where they've been.
I've never said she was bad. At higher elo, people are better at playing as a team and exploiting her weaknesses.

They created Vayne's paradise by nerfing all of the assassins **and** nerfing all the strong early game adcs. The table is set pretty much perfectly for Vayne, tanks are everywhere for her to shred on the enemy team while tanks on her team protect her. Bodyguard supports like Janna, Alistar, and Nautilus are in vogue, making her even more protected in teamfights and giving her free laning phases as well. Season 5 changes are also very favorable to her; the new dragon buffs and Baron buff makes sieging far easier which was one of Vayne's main weaknesses in the past; Mid laners now have Ludens so Vayne doesn't need to waveclear for her team anymore, and all of her items have gotten buffed while other adc items have been nerfed; Botrk, PD have both been buffed considerably while IE and Shiv by extension have been nerfed.

>She has around the same range as Quinn; another "hyper carry" with self peel.

Vayne has 550 range, which is about the average for an ADC. Quinn only has 525 range.
I agree! I want to start learning how to play her. Is she a difficult champion to learn?

Very. She's one of the hardest ADC's to play well. Takes a ton of practice to CS well, tumble the right way at the right time, with the long cooldowns, you can really die very easily (contrary to the author's feelings on this thread). 

Quinn actually has a ton more mobility than Vayne, but the leap bugs on Quinn have kept her from competitive play I believe. She doesn't leap predictably, nor does valor mark consistently.

I hate to sound rude, but you make it sound as if it takes a lot of time to learn how to CS well WITH VAYNE. No, you can learn to CS at level 1 using any champion you'd please. So no, this does not make her challenging at all, especially since she can play safely until she manages to hit a level where her W does enough damage to minions on the third shot that she doesn't even need to try anymore. When it comes to her Tumble, I don't know why you think this is so hard either. It's relatively easy to Q and land that hit on their ADC. Not to mention, when she chases and uses her Q when there's already two stacks of her W on the opponent, my god does that do insane damage. You say that her cooldowns can be taken advantage of, however this is so easy to fix. Literally, play safely until you have BorK, and then farm. Early game is the best chance you have, and you most likely would need a jungler that is smart enough to realize her Q's cooldown, wait for her to waste it, and then actually have to mobility AND assassination potential to actually scrape a kill on her. Did I forget to mention that she also has an E to push said jungler out of her face? I know of about two or three junglers that actually have the mobility to make it to her PRE-6 and STILL manage to kill her even if her E is up and they just waited for her to waste her Tumble.

Every ADC is dangerous if they are safe. Every one. That's their Role, to be massive damage dealers. They can all deal lots of damage, if they are safe. You're saying Vayne is dangerous if she is safe, no shit, they all are. You never seen a fed Jinx? Fed Lucian? Fed Graves? Fed Ezreal? Fed Trist? 

Vayne isn't any "safer" than Jinx with Chompers, or Sivir with Speed up, or Trist with Rocket Jump, or Ezreal with Arcane Shift, or Quinn with Tag Team, etc etc.

So she has one knockback that has a long ass cooldown, if you waste it, and you're against a Lee Sin, you're dead. Lee Sin Q will come off CD way faster, and he can gap close. Renekton can catch Vayne, Tryndamere can catch Vayne, Irelia can catch Vayne. What will Vayne do against a Zac ult? Sejuani ult? CC destroys her, just like every ADC.

I see Vayne like maybe once in LCS every split, why? because her weakness is that she cannot switch targets, she can only focus on single target, and yes, if she is free to pound on a single target then she, like all adc's will kill that target.

If she is that easy to win with, I challenge you to take yourself to Master tier just by playing Vayne. It isn't as easy as you are making it sound.

Vayne is far safer than Jinx or Sivir, since they don't have any self peel against highly mobile skirmishers like {{champion:92}} {{champion:11}}  {{champion:157}} . Once a skirmisher, damage bruiser or assassin sticks to Sivir or Jinx, they are dead without peel. Not so for Vayne. Even Yi has a hard time sticking to her, yet the funny thing is, Yi does way better at sticking to Vayne than almost any other champ in the game.

Sivir-- Well, I'm not sure. She moves fast, but shes a teamfight ADC. I'd hope her quickened team would help to protect her.


Yi should have no trouble sticking to Vayne. Yi just saves his Q for after she E's, and then she has nothing left to escape with.
Yasuo, maybe not-- but Yasuo doesn't stick unless he has minions/champs to continuously E through.
Riven? Riven would actually just blow up Vayne without a second thought. Vayne does NOT have the range or peel/escape to deal with a champ that has four gap closers, two CCs, and crud tons of damage.

Vayne is good at chasing people. Vayne is _not_ that good at running from people. She, like most other ADC's, has one "oh fuck" escape button, her E. Q isn't that great for escaping, as it is for potentially dodging around skillshots.

I've played this matchup {{champion:11}}  vs {{champion:67}}  many times in your elo, as well as against Sivir and Jinx as well. I've never had as much trouble with assassinating ADCs as a sustained damage melee, as I do against Vayne.

Played optimally, Yi is at a huge disadvantage, especially late game.

Mid game, Yi destroys Vayne because his base stats and maybe 1 early tank item are too much for her still relatively low AS and AD to handle, while he deals way too much mixed damage with BoRK, devourer and wuju style. Late game when everyone is 6 slotted, assuming Yi has not snowballed out of control and ended the game early, Vayne shits on Yi even 1v1. Yi has to run at Vayne to not have to Q onto her and thus leaving himself open to E, but Vayne in that time can land 2-3 free shots on Yi, which chunks him for at least 40% his HP if he built bruiser or 80% if he built full glass. Then all she needs is to land 2-3 more autos to kill him which isn't hard, since even late game Yi can't 1 shot Vayne and needs at least 3-4 autos, assuming he could afford to build crit. Most of the time Yi on a jungler budget can't afford to build crit without snowballing hard.

Also, Vayne destroys Riven because she needs to spend 2 gapcloser to get to Vayne, while Vayne can cancel her 3rd Q with E and get free hits. Each free hit, of course, chunks Riven because she is extremely squishy all game.

You are just describing what an ADC does at late game. You are saying, when an ADC has full build they destroy everyone. You think Jinx with full AD/AS/Crit can't wipe Yi or Riven or whomever. She will DESTROY THEM. All ADC  all squishy, with no additional hp, armor, nor mr. If they get caught they die.

Vayne has one escape from a gap closer, and it's not a physical movement escape meaning she doesn't move, she knocks THEM and on ONE champ only (Trist Ult actually will knock a whole group and then she can Jump away, try catching a Trist). If Maokai locks her down, she's done if there is any follow up. A flash-stun-tibbers from Annie, and who is Vayne gonna knockback? Tibbers? If there is follow-up, she's done. Trundle Pillar behind her? where is Vayne gonna go? What about Vi ult? Ok after Vi ult, Vayne uses E, guess what, Vi just charges up a Q and is right back in her face, and now what will Vayne do? What about a Morg Q? What does Vayne E do for that? Guess what, Black Shield, well shit, now the E doesn't even work. How about Sivir Spellshielding Vayne E, not only does save her vs the 3rd bolt, but also no knockback. Amumu Q into Amumu Ult? Fiddlesticks Fear and Silence, oops now you can't cast E for like 8 seconds? Ok, Nocturne Ult into Fear-Flash. Ok, how about Nautilus ult, followed by a Naut Q and auto-attack?  

While any ADC will definitely take out a single target caught out, 1 v 1, pretty much almost any target at this point in the game (late game full build like you are saying). They cannot take out the whole team without a ton of protection by their own team, because while they are trying to take out one enemy, they are vulnerable to the others. Vayne is just as susceptible as all the rest.

If you watch LCS or Master/Challenger games, you'll see the immense focus on locking down the ADC. If they kill the ADC mid to late game, they typically can win the game, or at least get a major objective. This is the whole strategy of the game, but it's not that simple or easy of course. It's what separates the best teams from the average, AT THE PRO LEVEL, and no different at any other level.

Jinx doesn't have anywhere near the self peel of Vayne. If she gets caught at ANY point in the game alone, she is dead. assuming equal gold. Vayne can actually duel many bruisers 1v1. That's where you have a huge misconception, that ADCs are supposed to be great duelists. Jinx isn't a great duelist.

Huh? where are you getting this from? Jinx got me my first Penta.  Jinx w (slow) and e (snare) can lock down the target and then she pounds them. Have you ever been hit by a Braum Q, where Jinx throws E behind you at the same time? What you gonna do then? 

If you are saying that you should stand still and auto that sometimes you will die? No shit, ADC's have no armor, health or mr, they have to kite. It's all positioning. 

People are just making up stuff now to QQ.

Let's just say you have a few options for late game carry's.

-You have Tristana, who's thing is blowing up buildings and on demand mobility, but doing damage requires bursting explosions on the enemy like a water gun carnival game.

-You have Jinx, who has good zone control and aoe dps, but only gets mobility if something dies, leaving her as a sitting duck otherwise.

-You have Graves, amazing burst but not much for a sustained fight otherwise.

-Ashe, probably the best zone control but zero mobility as a penalty, also requires a bit of revving up before she can warm up to duel anyone.

-Quinn, probably the best on point mobility and burst but suffers by having to exhaust everything to do so.


Then there's Vayne. Do you know how to position yourself correctly? Good. There's no Niche for Vayne, just pure, on point damage. Do you like MLG LCS plays? Then Vayne is for you.

All other ADC's are villains of the week, and Vayne is Star Platinum. They'll have their tricks and their gadgets, but you are Vayne. Your kit is made to subdue and kill the enemy. Nothing more, nothing less.
